channel.title: Need help with server
channel.description:
ok so in my client file i changed the ip to my no-ip
I'm not sure what else I need to do to avoid the "couldn't connect to server" message I get.
Do I need to change something in my server files? and yes i've portforwarded.
I think my server is still running as a local server (127.0.0.1) but i may need to change it to my no-ip?

item.title: Need help with server
item.dc:creator: @m_st3r8 m st3r8
item.description:
@m_st3r8 wrote:

I just started my java class so im not that great yet… anyways how can I change this? Ive modified like everything to my no-ip but the port thing (i used u torrent to portforward) isn’t seeming to work…

oh and i set my port to 43594

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with server
item.dc:creator: @ztr_zac1 ztr zac
item.description:
@ztr_zac1 wrote:

[quote=“m st3r8, post:11, topic:364205”]im not using delta

im not leaching because it was a released server base

i tryed it on the canyouseeme or w/e that didnt work, also tryed on moparscape client that said it was timed out also. wtf?[/quote]

We’re not accusing you of leeching… People put anti-leech into the servers so people can;t just download the server and run it as it is claiming it as their own. Only people with atleast SOME knowledge of java and MS server development can remove the anti-leech, which if they do that, the chances are they are both capable and looking to modify the source in some way.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with server
item.dc:creator: @ztr_zac1 ztr zac
item.description:
@ztr_zac1 wrote:

[quote=“m st3r8, post:8, topic:364205”]i turned off my firewall completely.

and now it keeps saying my connection timed out? is this a problem with no-ip?[/quote]

Well if the message has changed then your firewall WAS blocking it, and yeahnow it sounds like an anti leech

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with server
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You can connect from your computer to the no-ip you set up to test to see if it is up.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with server
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

use a port checker to see if you port forwarded correctly, and you can also check to see if it will connect through another computer by using a client configured with your no-ip redirect.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with server
item.dc:creator: @m_st3r8 m st3r8
item.description:
@m_st3r8 wrote:

well im just trying to test it to make sure it will work online… shold i try connecting from a different computer for it to work?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with server
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

if you are trying to connect to a server being hosted on your computer with a client, just leave the ip as “127.0.0.1” or “localhost”. the client that you give out to players should have your no-ip redirect configured into the client. otherwise, you shouldn’ t have to portforward to connect from localhost. if you cannot connect from localhost, you may have a client compatibility issue in relation to your server base.

Read full topic
